contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox sportsperson |birth_date=November 25, 1973 |birth_place= |medaltemplates={{MedalSport | Men's [[Athletics (sport)|Athletics]]}} {{MedalCountry | {{CUB}} }} {{MedalCompetition|[[Athletics at the Summer Olympics|Olympic Games]]}} {{MedalSilver| [[2000 Summer Olympics|2000 Sydney]] | Triple Jump}} {{MedalCompetition|World Indoor Championships}} {{MedalGold |[[1997 IAAF World Indoor Championships|1997 Paris]]|Triple Jump}} }} '''Yoel García Luis''' (born November 25, 1973 in [[Nueva Gerona]], [[Isla de la Juventud]]) is a [[Cuba]]n [[triple jump]]er who he won the silver medal at the [[Athletics at the 2000 Summer Olympics|2000 Summer Olympics]], equalling his personal best with 17.47. His first Olympics was the one of [[Athletics at the 1996 Summer Olympics|1996]], where he finished 20th in the qualification round. ==Competition record== {| {{AchievementTable}} |- !colspan="6"|Representing the {{CUB}} |- |rowspan=2|1995 |[[Athletics at the 1995 Pan American Games|Pan American Games]] |[[Mar del Plata, Argentina]] |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |17.21 m (w) |- |[[1995 World Championships in Athletics|World Championships]] |[[Gothenburg, Sweden]] |5th |[[1995 World Championships in Athletics – Men's triple jump|17.16 m]] |- |1996 |[[Athletics at the 1996 Summer Olympics|Olympic Games]] |[[Atlanta, United States]] |20th (q) |[[Athletics at the 1996 Summer Olympics – Men's triple jump|16.62 m]] |- |rowspan=3|1997 |[[1997 IAAF World Indoor Championships|World Indoor Championships]] |[[Paris, France]] |bgcolor=gold|1st |17.30 m |- |[[1997 Central American and Caribbean Championships in Athletics|Central American and Caribbean Championships]] |[[San Juan, Puerto Rico]] |bgcolor=silver|2nd |17.28 m (w) |- |[[1997 World Championships in Athletics|World Championships]] |[[Athens, Greece]] |15th (q) |[[1997 World Championships in Athletics – Men's triple jump|16.79 m]] |- |1999 |[[1999 World Championships in Athletics|World Championships]] |[[Seville, Spain]] |21st (q) |[[1999 World Championships in Athletics – Men's triple jump|16.56 m]] |- |2000 |[[Athletics at the 2000 Summer Olympics|Olympic Games]] |[[Sydney, Australia]] |bgcolor=silver|2nd |[[Athletics at the 2000 Summer Olympics – Men's triple jump|17.47 m]] |- |2001 |[[2001 World Championships in Athletics|World Championships]] |[[Edmonton, Canada]] |4th |[[2001 World Championships in Athletics – Men's triple jump|17.40 m]] |- |2004 |[[2004 Ibero-American Championships in Athletics|Ibero-American Championships]] |[[Huelva, Spain]] |bgcolor=silver|2nd |[[2004 Ibero-American Championships in Athletics – Results#Triple jump|16.59 m]] |} ==Personal Best== *Indoor 17.62 m
